# UICollectionLayoutListConfiguration.HeaderMode.firstItemInSection

**Case**

A header mode that styles the first item in a section as a header.

## Declaration

```swift
case firstItemInSection
```

## Discussion

Choose this header mode when you’re using hierarchical data sources if you want to be able to expand and collapse the header.

When you use this header mode, a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionViewListCell] object that appears as the first item in the section automatically uses a header appearance. When you configure your data source, make sure to account for the fact that the first item in the section (at index `0`) represents the header, and the actual items in the section start at index `1`.

By default, lists that use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionLayoutListConfiguration-swift.struct/Appearance-swift.enum/plain] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionLayoutListConfiguration-swift.struct/Appearance-swift.enum/sidebarPlain] list appearances use pinned headers. If you want to opt into this default pinning behavior, use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionLayoutListConfiguration-swift.struct/HeaderMode-swift.enum/supplementary] header mode instead.

## Header modes

- **UICollectionLayoutListConfiguration.HeaderMode.none**: No headers are shown.
- **UICollectionLayoutListConfiguration.HeaderMode.supplementary**: A header mode that uses supplementary views to show headers.
